relation: Color of the prompt (which is the current path and ">").
Color of the command line entered by the user.
Color of the currently selected directory (when the user is presented with a list).
Color of the process exit code (when ReportStatus is 1).
If 1, the exit code of a process is reported after it finishes.
If 1, the entire background will use the Aero Glass effect. Requires Vista or later.
If 1, the command history is not recorded between sessions.

The transparency of the console window (from 0 to 255, where 0 is completely opaque). Please note that if Glass is enabled, this transparency is additive to the transparency that is inherent with Glass. Unfortunately it is not possible to reduce the transparency of Glass.

textBeforeTable: Output The %ErrorLevel% environment variable will be set to one of the following: Don't display the program banner. /nologo Instead of processing just a single file, processes all files in a folder.  Press Escape to abort. /folder DIGSIG [/folder] [/nologo] filepath Usage verifies the digital signature DIGSIG.EXE Click here Download Deleted files are not moved to the Recycle Bin, they are permanently deleted.  For a good undelete utility, we recommend Back2Life. When a file specification contains an absolute path, all subsequent file specifications will be relative to that path (but only when using a semi-colon separator).  Note that the example above depends on this. You may press the Escape key to abort the operation once it has started. We are not responsible for damage caused by the use of this program, or any other program, even if it contains bugs.  This is a powerful program with the ability to seriously screw up your computer. Notes DELS.EXE 2.0 - Recursive File Deletion Utility Copyright (C) 2001-2015 by Greg Wittmeyer - All Switches: of a file. DIGSIG.EXE to download version 2.0 of DELS.EXE (released June 3rd, 2015).
textAfterTable: The file is locked. 10 Unsupported file type. 11 A certificate was revoked by the issuer. 12 A certificate is expired. 13 The signature or certificate is malformed. 14 The signature could not be verified. Example #1 >digsig c:\work\foo.exe DigSig 2.1 - Digital Signature Verification Utility Copyright (C) 2010-2013 by Greg Wittmeyer - All Rights Reserved Code 11: A certificate was revoked by the issuer. Example #2 >digsig /folder c:\work DigSig 2.1 - Digital Signature Verification Utility Copyright (C) 2010-2013 by Greg Wittmeyer - All Rights Reserved c:\work\foo.exe : No signature is present. c:\work\bar.exe : The signature is present, and was validated successfully. c:\work\baz.exe : The file is not trusted. Download Click here to download version 2.1 of DIGSIG.EXE (released September 11th, 2013). FCMP.EXE FCMP.EXE compares two files, reporting whether or not they are the same. Usage FCMP [/e#] [/f] [/i#] [/n#] [/nologo] [/s] [/sdo] [/snp] file1 file2 Compares file1 to file2, and reports if they are the same size and identical, byte for byte. Switches: /e End at
